page.title: 12 GILLING WEST VILLAGE
page.content:
Most of the houses in Gilling are made of greyish coloured bricks but some of them are made of stone.The very old buildings are stone and the newer buildings are mostly made of bricks. Most of the roofs are made of slate.
As you walk through the village you will see the school,built in 1847. Further along,there is Town End Farm which has unusual arched windows.Past the farm there is the Church.Some of it was built in the eleventh century. There is also a Village Hall where several activities take place.
There is one shop in Gilling. It is a Post Office as well as a General Store and sells most things. A baker's van calls every Friday night, a butcher's van on Wednesday & Friday afternoons and a fish van on Friday mornings.
